background: An artisan makes two types of terracotta jars: a thin jar and a stubby jar.
constraints: Number of thin jars is an integer
Number of stubby jars is an integer
Number of thin jars is non-negative
Number of stubby jars is non-negative
Total shaping time for thin and stubby jars cannot exceed TotalShapingTime minutes per week
Total baking time for thin and stubby jars cannot exceed TotalBakingTime minutes per week
objective: Maximize the artisan's weekly profit from the jars
description: An artisan makes two types of terracotta jars: a thin jar and a stubby jar. Each thin jar requires \var{ThinShapingTime} minutes of shaping time and \var{ThinBakingTime} minutes of baking time. Each stubby jar requires \var{StubbyShapingTime} minutes of shaping time and \var{StubbyBakingTime} minutes of baking time. Per week, there are \var{TotalShapingTime} minutes available for shaping and \var{TotalBakingTime} minutes available for baking. The profit per thin jar is \var{ProfitThin} and the profit per stubby jar is \var{ProfitStubby}. How many jars of each type should the artisan make to maximize profit?

parameters.definition: Minutes required to shape one thin jar
Minutes required to bake one thin jar
Minutes required to shape one stubby jar
Minutes required to bake one stubby jar
Total available shaping minutes per week
Total available baking minutes per week
